title: 70mm cement splicer
material_description: Painted cast iron, stainless steel, rubber
brief_description: A film splicer is an essential tool for film editing, enabling the physical joining of film strips. This splicer is designed for cement joins on 70mm film, the largest standard motion picture format. Splicing with cement requires the removal of photographic emulsion from the film end, application of film cement (a solvent-based adhesive) and precise alignment when fusing the two film segments. Cement splices create a strong join along the frame edge and is usually not visible when film is projected.
